title: No child node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
description: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no child node listing.
OB: There is no child node listing when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Closing the data set editor and reopening it does not resolve the issue.
EB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the child node listing should be updated to reflect the database/table/column information of the new data source. Closing and reopening the data set editor should also update the child node listing accordingly.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement.
2. Go to the data set editor page and navigate to the data source section.
3. Change the data source to a new one.
4. Verify that the child node listing does not show any database/table/column information.

Expected behavior:
- The child node listing should be updated to display the database/table/column information of the new data source.
- Closing and reopening the data set editor should update the child node listing accordingly.
